body: /pulsarbot run-failure-checks

@rdhabalia Looks the failed CI can't be triggered again, I'm not sure what the problem is. And I try to merge the apache/master to this branch, it still nothing happens in this branch. Interesting thing!
@huangdx0726 Could you please take a look at the failed CI tests? looks related to the maven poms.
@wolfstudy Could you please take a look at this issue?
/pulsarbot run-failure-checks
@eolivelli I noticed that you had done some changes to allow compiling with JDK 14+. Have you come across the ByteBuffer incompatibilities?
/pulsarbot run-failure-checks
@codelipenghui I have rebased the PR. I think this should fix it.

This problem should not only exist in 2.6.2, but it should also be a master problem, @zymap helped to verify the logic with JDK 1.8, it seems that everything is OK. It looks like we need to support different JDK versions to build Apache Pulsar.

@kent-crypto Is it possible that we just use consumer.[pause](https://pulsar.apache.org/api/client/)() to stop receiving message from broker and process/ack outstanding messages before closing the consumer. Seem this can also achieve what you describe.

Hi,

Please have a look into this PR.

It will be useful if arm64 jobs are added in Travis-CI. If you are interested, I can help by raising another PR for adding arm64 jobs in Travis-CI.

@massakam Could you please rebase to the apache/master branch? Thanks.
@merlimat @sijie @jiazhai Could you please also help review this PR?
@eaba Could you please help resolve the conflicts?
/pulsarbot run-failure-checks
@rdhabalia Could you please also rebase this PR to apache/master?
@hangc0276 Are you working on implement this fix?

> We should add maven.compiler.release=8 in our pom.xml, it must be done in a profile activated when you are on jdk9+, it is a quite easy fix.

@eolivelli I think it would be valuable. It's easy to miss that you must compile Pulsar with Java 8 since the compilation passes without errors and even at runtime the errors are swallowed and not logged (at least in this particular case). Very hard to debug.

I guess that if you build with JDK14+ and you run everything on JDK14+ you won't hit problems.
probably you are not going to run Pulsar on JDK8, as newer JVMs are generally (I don't want to start a discussion now) more efficient and provide better performances.

In BK community we are switching to JDK11+ (but still next release will work on JDK8)
/pulsarbot run-failure-checks

@KannarFr Hi, KannarFr, a few days ago, the offload related code had been refined, it seems that the AWS role credentials had been removed, maybe we could repair it in this PR? Refer to the class `JCloudBlobStoreProvider`.

LGTM

I found the problem.

Because the Pulsar server using the standalone mode, the advertisedAddress= inside the conf/standalone.conf file needed to be set. After setting this the exception is gone.

@murong00 If users disabled the topic auto-creation or subscription auto-creation. Users should create a Topic or Subscription for perf test, any reason for introducing new options in #8342? If current --topic and --subscription can't use the existing topic and subscription, I think we should fix it rather than adding more options.

@hadesy Which Pulsar version are you using? we have added the publish buffer limitation `maxMessagePublishBufferSizeInMB` for the broker in 2.5.1. If you are using an old version, you can try to add system.d for the broker, Or you can try to upgrade the broker version to the last release.

@rivernate Could you please provide the version information of the Pulsar broker and pulsar-client-admin?
@gaoran10 Could you please help take a look at this issue, seems we have already fixed in the master branch, please help double-check.
@codelipenghui 2.6.1

@hadesy ok, could you please provide the persistent policy(EnsembleSize, WriteQuorum, AckQuorum)? Currently, if the AckQuorum < WriteQuorum and there is one bookie always in the slow write state, this might cause the buffer can't release quickly.
@rivernate Are you interested in implementing this feature? I think we can add a config in the broker.conf to enable or disable the Content-MD5 for the ledger offload.
@devinbost Seems we should clarify it in the document, are you interested in fix it?
ping @sijie @srkukarni Could you please help review this PR?
@congbobo184 Could you please take a look at this issue?

@robshep Could you please provide more information about the schema configuration? Which schema compatibility policy are you using? how the schema of the topic looks like now(You can use the pulsar-admin schemas to get the current schema of the topic)
@wolfstudy Could you please help take a look at this feature?

@alexku7 It's an internal topic in a namespace. We can store some configurations in the system topic such as the topic policy configurations. After the broker startup, we can recover the configurations from the system topic. And the system topic is a compacted topic, it will only retain the last value of a key, the old values of the key will be deleted automatically.
@devinbost Is it better to move this issue to https://github.com/apache/pulsar-helm-chart/issues? We have moved all helm charts to https://github.com/apache/pulsar-helm-chart/issues
@Huanli-Meng Any update on this issue?
